page.title: 05 FARMING - FAIRTROUGH FARM
page.content:
Farming is of major importance to the area. Although many of the residents of the nearby villages of Cudham, Downe, Pratts Bottom and Knockholt earn their living in the city of London, commuting to town each day, farming remains the main local industry. In addition to the commercial farms there are numerous small-holdings, nurseries, and riding stables in the area, creating a very rural atmosphere for part of a London Suburban Borough. In the following pages you can find a brief description of some local farms.
Fairtrough Farm occupies 145 acres, 35 acres of woodland and 110 acres of permanent grassland. The farmer keeps a small dairy herd of 86 cows and 25 calves. In the winter he rears turkeys for the Christmas market.
